content:
This course will serve as a basic introduction to design of refrigeration and air conditioning systems. The course will build upon the fundamentals of thermodynamics (ESO201) and apply it to RAC systems. It will introduce elements of basic RAC machinery and its operating principles and design issues.

Course Content:
Thermodynamics and heat transfer, Refrigeration/Heat Pump Cycles, Elements of a vapor compression refrigeration system, Types, Design calculations, Refrigerants and their impact on the environment, Thermodynamics of moist air, Psychrometry, Load calculations, Introduction to some non-conventional refrigeration systems, Industrial Applications/ Case studies/ Field visits/ Project.

INTENDED AUDIENCE: Primarily UG (May be interesting for some PGs also), Industry

PREREQUISITES: Intermediate with Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Basic Thermodynamics Course

INDUSTRY SUPPORT: Voltas, Carrier, Trans, Videocon, LG,
